intro: Ruellia haenkeana var. pilosa, commonly known as hairy ruellia, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of South America. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces clusters of blue to purple flowers, which bloom in the summer months. Its foliage is characterized by lance-shaped leaves covered in fine, soft hairs. Ruellia haenkeana var. pilosa is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and relatively low maintenance requirements.
